title: Programmers Technicians
description:
Imagine a world with zero vehicle accidents, zero vehicle emissions, and wireless vehicle connectivity all around us. Every day, we move closer to making that world a reality. Aptiv's passionate team of engineers and developers creates advanced safety systems, high-performance electrification solutions and data connectivity solutions so that automakers can bring advanced capabilities to more people around the globe. This is how we enable sustainable mobility and help to prevent accidents caused by human error.
Want to join us?
Key Responsibilities:
Connectivity System Development: Design, configure, and maintain digitalization systems using multiple software solutions to monitor and control manufacturing processes, ensuring efficiency and reliability.
Machines Connectivity: Collaborate with the central and local team to implement connectivity protocols, hardware, and software, ensuring seamless communication between machinery and digitalization systems.
Database Management: Manage and maintain databases for efficient storage, retrieval, and analysis of real-time data.
Data Analysis: Develop data analysis for interpretation and reporting to support data-driven decision-making.
Collaboration: Work closely with stakeholders from various departments and central teams, including maintenance, IT, production, quality, and engineering, to ensure coordinated efforts and efficient operations.
Data Acquisition: ensure data acquisition to collect real-time data from machinery and equipment within the plant, developing solutions for data storage, analysis, and reporting.
HMI Design: Create intuitive Human-Machine Interface (HMI) screens and dashboards to enable operators to monitor and control manufacturing processes effectively.
Data Visualization: Develop charts and graphs using BI tools to transform data into insightful visual representations that aid decision-making.
Troubleshooting: Identify and resolve issues within the connectivity system, ensuring minimal downtime and a prompt response to technical problems.
Integration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate connectivity systems with other software and hardware components, including PLCs and industrial sensors.
Security: Implement and maintain cybersecurity measures to protect systems from external threats and unauthorized access, following APTIV's cybersecurity guidelines.
Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of connectivity system designs, configurations, and changes for future reference and auditing.
Training: Train plant personnel on connectivity system operation and best practices for efficient use.
Compliance: Ensure that connectivity systems adhere to industry standards and safety regulations.
Connectivity Specification & Validation: Define connectivity specifications and validate their implementation.
IT/OT HW/SW Installation & Configuration: Install and configure IT/OT hardware and software, including operating systems and IT security patches.
IP Address Allocation & Troubleshooting: Manage IP address allocation and troubleshoot network issues as needed.
Screen Designing & Data Validation: Design screens and validate data to ensure accuracy and usability.
Connectivity Maintenance: Maintain connectivity during maintenance activities and engineering changes.
Implementation Leadership: Lead the implementation of machine connectivity projects for existing, new projects, and engineering changes. Coordination: Coordinate between plant engineering, central IT, and Maintenance and Engineering teams.
Follow-up and Training: Provide ongoing support and training to plant engineers to ensure effective utilization of connectivity systems.
System Administration: Administer the connectivity system and ensure its smooth operation
Your background:
Two-year degree in software development and embedded systems automation.
+1 year of experience in software development.
Knowledge in software development and embedded systems automation.
Why join us?
You can grow at Aptiv. Aptiv provides an inclusive work environment where all individuals can grow and develop, regardless of gender, ethnicity or beliefs.
You can have an impact. Safety is a core Aptiv value; we want a safer world for us and our children, one with: Zero fatalities, Zero injuries, Zero accidents.
You have support. We ensure you have the resources and support you need to take care of your family and your physical and mental health with a competitive health insurance package.
Apply today and together let’s change tomorrow!
“Important Company Update – Please Read Before Applying. On January 22, 2025, Aptiv announced its decision to separate its EDS division to form two separate independent companies: https://www.automotiveworld.com/news-releases/aptiv-announces-intention- to-separate-its-electrical-distribution-systems-business/
This role is within the EDS segment, and you will be joining that segment as it becomes its own entity, with a rich heritage and proven track record as a global leader in low and high voltage power and signal distribution systems. Our solutions are central to enabling the next generation of electrified, automated, and connected vehicles, and we are committed to innovation, sustainability, and engineering excellence.
We are looking for talented individuals who are excited by the opportunity to help shape the future of EDS and delivering industry-leading solutions to the world’s top automotive manufacturers.”
Privacy Notice - Active Candidates: https://www.aptiv.com/privacy-notice-active-candidates
Aptiv is an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Aeeronautique engineer-Internship Program
description:
Capgemini Engineering, leader mondial des services d'ingénierie, rassemble des équipes d'ingénieurs, de scientifiques et d'architectes pour aider les entreprises les plus innovantes dans le monde à libérer leur potentiel. Des voitures autonomes aux robots qui sauvent des vies, nos experts en technologies digitales et logicielles sortent des sentiers battus en fournissant des services uniques de R&D et d'ingénierie dans tous les secteurs d'activité. Rejoignez-nous pour une carrière pleine d'opportunités, où vous pouvez faire la différence et où aucun jour ne se ressemble.
A propos du stage
Nous sommes à la recherche d’un(e) stagiaire motivé(e) pour rejoindre notre équipe technique en tant qu’ Assistant(e) Ingénieur Aéronautique .
Ce stage est une opportunité unique d’acquérir une expérience concrète dans un environnement industriel aéronautique, en participant à l’ optimisation des procédés de fabrication , à la gestion technique des opérations , et à des projets d’ amélioration continue liés aux normes et exigences du secteur.
Lieu : Casablanca
Durée : 6 mois, à partir de février
Niveau : Étudiant(e) en dernière année de cycle ingénieur ou Master en Génie Aéronautique, Génie Mécanique appliqué à l’aérospatial, ou équivalent
Langues : Bon niveau en français et en anglais
Les missions du stage
Analyse des processus de production aéronautique et identification des axes d’amélioration
Participation à la mise en place de procédures techniques et d’outils de suivi adaptés aux exigences du secteur
Suivi des indicateurs de performance : qualité, coûts, délais, conformité réglementaire
Collaboration avec les équipes de production, maintenance, qualité et logistique
Contribution à l’optimisation des flux internes et à la réduction des gaspillages (Lean, 5S, etc.)
Participation à la digitalisation et à la standardisation des processus industriels
Votre profil
Étudiant(e) en Génie Aéronautique , Génie Mécanique appliqué à l’aérospatial , ou équivalent
Intérêt marqué pour les environnements industriels aéronautiques et les processus techniques du secteur
Bonne capacité d’ analyse , esprit critique et sens de l’optimisation
Sens de l’ organisation , rigueur et autonomie dans le travail
Maîtrise des outils bureautiques ( Excel, Word ) et idéalement des logiciels spécialisés ( CAO comme CATIA, SolidWorks , ou outils de gestion technique)
Nos engagements et priorités:
Le groupe Capgemini encourage une culture inclusive dans un cadre multiculturel et handi-accueillant. En nous rejoignant, vous intégrez un collectif qui valorise la diversité, développe le potentiel de ses talents, s’engage dans des initiatives solidaires avec ses partenaires, et se mobilise pour réduire son impact environnemental sur tous ses sites et auprès de ses clients.
Capgemini est un leader mondial, responsable et multiculturel, regroupant près de 350 000 personnes dans plus de 50 pays. Fort de 55 ans d’expérience, nous sommes un partenaire stratégique des entreprises pour la transformation de leurs activités en tirant profit de toute la puissance de la technologie et des innovations dans les domaines en perpétuelle évolution tels que le cloud, la data, l’Intelligence Artificielle, la connectivité, les logiciels, l’ingénierie digitale ou les plateformes.

title: Power Pro Intern – SSP Morocco
description:
SIEMENS
Rabat
Stage
Sur site
il y a 1 semaine(s)

Siemens Digital Industry Software – Tomorrow with Us! Meet the team – Video
Based: Morocco, Onsite
Siemens Digital Industries Software is a leading provider of solutions for the design, simulation, and manufacture of products across many different industries. Formula 1 cars, skyscrapers, ships, space exploration vehicles, and many of the objects we see in our daily lives are being conceived and manufactured using our Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) software. We offer a role with responsibility, independence, and the possibility to give proactively, by encouraging a collaboration culture with room for individual development.
Do you like to challenge yourself to figure out innovative solutions to problems and translate them to efficient code? If the answer is yes, then come work with us on the next generation power estimation and logic optimization technologies under PowerPro product line.
Have you ever thought how RTL designers are estimating power consumption of a semiconductor chip being designed for modern usage like crypto mining or AI hardware acceleration even before making them for real? The potential answer is PowerPro.
Start your career with the Strategic Student Program (SSP)!
The SSP is our formal internship programs at SIEMENS Software. You will be mentored by guides and work directly with costumers to create direct business impact and again invaluable professional experience!
The program is a 6 months internship in from February to August 2026. There will be opportunity to learn and contribute in a variety of areas of the software development process, with emphasis on a number of achievable projects to both encourage your development and deliver something useful.
Job Responsibilities:
Your responsibilities will include contributing to the development of new features for Power Analysis.
You will be responsible for making enhancement to existing functionality in PowerPro.
We are looking for a results-oriented and accountable person.
Collaborate with the Product Validation team in the development of testing strategies.
Collaborate and coordinate with other engineering teams.
Qualifications:
Final year of Engineering studies in Computer Science / Electronics & Electronics (EEE) / Electronics & Communication Engineering (ECE).
Knowledge of C++, STL, Data Structures, Algorithms.
Some knowledge of all the development tools like gdb, valgrind, makefiles, editors, IDE, etc.
Soft skills
Self-motivated
Team player
Good problem solving and analytical skills
Hard working, sincere and committed to work
Good to have
Exposure to EDA, VLSI, ASIC design flows, Digital Logic, Synthesis, Low Power concepts.
Knowledge of scripting languages like Node.js/Perl/Tcl/Sed/Awk will be a plus.
Understanding in one of the HDL (Verilog, System Verilog, VHDL or SystemC) would be good
Why Working at Siemens Software?
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
We are Siemens
A collection of over 377,000 minds building the future, one day at a time in over 200 countries. We’re dedicated to equality, and we welcome applications that reflect the diversity of the communities we work in. All employment decisions at Siemens are based on qualifications, merit, and business need.

title: Costing Analyst
description:
Costing Analyst
What can you expect?
Adient (NYSE: ADNT) is a global leader in automotive seating. With 70,000+ employees in 29 countries, Adient operates more than 200 manufacturing/assembly plants worldwide. We produce and deliver automotive seating for all major OEMs. From complete seating systems to individual foam, trim and metal components, our expertise spans every step of the automotive seat-making process. Our integrated, in-house skills allow us to take our products from research and design to engineering and manufacturing — and into millions of vehicles every year. For more information, visit www.adient.com.
The role of the Costing Analyst is to ensure that accurate product costs are developed and communicated within the organization. Knowledge of product and process is critical. The candidate must be able to review product design and manufacturing process assumptions for reasonableness. The CA needs to be able to bring business perspective to this data. Project analysis and inter-company interface will be required on an ongoing basis.
What will your responsibilities be?
Development of product cost: material usage, material cost, equipment requirements, labor requirements, cycle times, tooling and capital requirements for new business or changes to current business
Review complex bill of materials for reasonableness
Review manufacturing assumptions for reasonableness
Develop risk / opportunities summary with each quote
Understand the Development of Pro-forma’s for new manufacturing facilities
Capacity to bring financial perspective to costing data.
Communicate / Educate the organization regarding the cost data
Rate Development
Develop / refine benchmark cost models to support our Purchasing team
Set targets of purchased items
Support Purchasing negotiations
Support regional and corporate initiatives
Ability to bridge financial data
Actively contribute to departmental initiatives/process improvements to enhance the overall department’s effectiveness
Commitment to use costing procedures and tools
Commitment to communicate with regional teams
Which qualifications are we looking for in potential employees?
University degree (Bachelor/Master, Finance, Business, or Engineering desired)
1-2 years experience preferably in costing or another financial role as e.g. financial analyst, costing analyst OR technical role as e.g. process engineer with sound understanding of financial aspects
Experience in the Automotive Industry
